citation.article-title: Streptococcus garvieae sp. nov. and Streptococcus plantarum sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Streptococcus plantarum sp. nov.
Streptococcus plantarum (L. gem pl. noun plantarum of plants)
Colonies on blood agar or nutrient agar are circular, smooth and entire.
Spheres or ovoid cells elongated in the direction of the chain; mostly in pairs or short chains.
Acid produced from amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, dextrin, fructose, glucose, maltose, mannose, D-mannitol, melizitose, N-acetylglucosamine, salicin, sucrose and trehalose.

Acid not produced from adonitol, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, galactose, gluconate, glycogen, glycerol, inositol, inulin, lactose, D-lyxose, melibiose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, α-methyl-D-mannoside, β-methylxyloside, raffinose, ribose, rhamnose, L-sorbose, D-tagatose, D-xylose, L-xylose and xylitol.
Variable results may be obtained for β-gentiobiose and D-turanose.
Starch, hippurate and gelatin not hydrolysed.
β-Galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, arginine dehydrolase and pyrrolidonylaryl-amidase negative.
The peptidoglycan type of NCDO 1869 is Lys-serine1-alanine1.
Major non-hydroxylated long-chain fatty acids are hexadecanoic, octadecenoic (ω7) and cis-11,12-methylenoctadecanoicacid (ΔC19:0).
The guanine plus cytosine content of DNA ranges from 36.9 to 38.1 mol% as determined by melting temperature (Tm).
